It was through the company, Essential Consultants, that adult-film actress Stormy Daniels was paid $130,000 to keep quiet about an alleged 2006 affair with Trump, and the company also negotiated a non-disclosure agreement related to an affair by Republican fund-raiser Elliott Broidy, the Journal reported.

Michael Cohen, President Donald Trump's personal lawyer, used the same Delaware shell company to pay off two women over alleged affairs with his clients, the Wall Street Journal reported Sunday night.
On Friday, the Journal said a former Playboy model received a total payout of $1.6 million after claiming Broidy had gotten her pregnant.
Broidy reportedly paid the company $250,000 in fees for the negotiations.
